item.title: Slippery pavement and pebble, 6th January
item.description:
This pavement and pebble change is very dangerous. We have seen multiple trips and people falling and bleeding heavily. It’s a public health hazard especially for elderly. The exact location is outside Bermondsey Bar and kitchen on bermondsey street opposite to urban hatch.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46-50, Bermondsey Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amounts of litter on Pett St, 6th January
item.description:
Large amounts of litter including glass bottles, paint cans, carpet, general trash, plastic caught in trees and other debris on Pett Street, from Woolwich Church Street junction, near the underpass to Parish Wharf and up to the new development. Litter has been there for at least a month but could be longer, plastic in the trees has been there at least since the summer but again could be longer.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Church Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drains are collapsing, 6th January
item.description:
The drains are collapsing and now pose an immediate and serious danger to cyclists and other road users. Vehicles striking these defects are being thrown off balance, causing suspension damage and producing extremely loud impact noises. The resulting shockwaves are generating severe vibrations that are affecting nearby buildings. This situation is no longer tolerable and requires urgent, priority repair before someone is seriously injured or further structural damage occurs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell New Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
